publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2574 Roseanna Cunningham: Imprisonment of Ngawang Sangdrol—That the Parliament recognises the plight of Buddhist nun Ngawang Sangdrol who, along with her fellow nuns from the Garu monastery, was arrested and imprisoned in August 1990 for attending a pro-independence demonstration in Lhasa; notes reports which indicate that Ngawang Sangdrol is currently due to be released in 2013 by which time she will be only 36 years old and yet will have been imprisoned for 21 years, and expresses its support for Amnesty International’s campaign to have Ngawang Sangdrol released from prison in Tibet.

S1M-2574 Roseanna Cunningham: Imprisonment of Ngawang Sangdrol-That the Parliament recognises the plight of Buddhist nun Ngawang Sangdrol who, along with her fellow nuns from the Garu monastery, was arrested and imprisoned in August 1990 for attending a pro-independence demonstration in Lhasa; notes reports which indicate that Ngawang Sangdrol is currently due to be released in 2013 by which time she will be only 36 years old and yet will have been imprisoned for 21 years, and expresses its support for Amnesty International's campaign to have Ngawang Sangdrol released from prison in Tibet. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson*, Brian Adam*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-2574 Imprisonment of Ngawang Sangdrol (lodged on 20 December 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2574 Imprisonment of Ngawang Sangdrol (lodged on 20 December 2001) Michael Matheson*, Shona Robison*, Linda Fabiani*, Tommy Sheridan*, Christine Grahame*
